thread.title: How Josh Hutcherson feels about the gender pay gap
thread.title_full: How Josh Hutcherson feels about the gender pay gap

title: How Josh Hutcherson feels about the gender pay gap
text:
By Lauren Moraski CBS News October 23, 2015, 4:55 PM Josh Hutcherson backs ​Jennifer Lawrence on Hollywood gender pay gap 
Josh Hutcherson attends the World Premiere of "The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 1" at Odeon Leicester Square on Nov. 10, 2014, in London, England. Tim P. Whitby/Getty Images More + 
Jennifer Lawrence's "Hunger Games" co-star Josh Hutcherson has her back. 
Lawrence, 25, recently penned an essay about the gender pay gap in Hollywood for Lena Dunham's Lenny newsletter titled "Why Do I Make Less Than My Male Co‑Stars?" - and Hutcherson apparently liked what he read. The duo starred in "American Sniper" where Cooper played Navy SEAL Chris Kyle and Miller played his wife. Now, in their new movie, Cooper portray... 
"I thought it was incredible," he told MTV News , adding, "I'm really proud of her, and happy," Hutcherson told MTV. "She's always been a little gun-shy. She's always said what she thinks, but as far as tackling issues, she's never really stepped up to do that. It's nice to see her now taking that step, being progressive, and using her voice not just to make people laugh." 
Hutcherson isn't Lawrence's only co-star backing her up. Her frequent co-star Bradley Cooper also chimed about the gender pay inequality in Hollywood during an interview Friday with "CBS This Morning," calling for more transparency. 
"It's such a taboo thing to talk about it -- what one makes," he said. © 2015 CBS Interactive Inc. All Rights Reserved. Shares
